45ab9a8fdd4b4c935251fa0c4cdda859.title: Revealed: the TRUTH behind the moon landing and 9/11 conspiracies

paragraphs.text: Such sceptical mindsets are currently grabbing headlines, with narratives around ‘fake news’ and ‘alternative facts’. “There’s a conspiracy-theory scare right now,” says Runciman. “But you can’t blame digital technology for this. For people who want to bypass conventional sources of information, it’s easier to do it. But the propensity of people to believe these things isn’t a modern phenomenon.”

3d7ebfedfed8.title: Not all conspiracy theories are false.

paragraphs.text: Not all conspiracy theories are false. And in todays bizarre world, many “experts” have a sinister hidden agenda, they lie, and often can’t be trusted. Warping the facts to fit your beliefs is always a bad thing of course — but whether or not one is inside or outside of the mainstream, that’s no longer an indication of being informed.

2fe3fe2c1bba.title: Conspiracies happen, but this does not mean that all conspiracies happen.

paragraphs.text: Conspiracies happen, but this does not mean that all conspiracies happen. Pattern recognition based on incomplete data leads to justifiable conclusions cementing emotional beliefs. Emotional connection to the idea, whether based in trust or distrust, solidifies opinions into a conspiracy theory, absent sufficient facts to illuminate the truth.

paragraphs.name: 27a9
paragraphs.text: Conspiracy theories about the fall of the twin towers are easily dismissed until one considers that the very first steel building in history to collapse of fire only (Building 7) fell the very same day.
If any one of the buildings was brought down by demolition, (as #7 most certainly had to be), then all three were.
